title: 162-I
statement: I. Truncatable primestime limit per test3 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutA truncatable prime is a prime number which contains no zeros in decimal notation and all its suffixes are primes. 1 is considered to be not a prime.You are given a positive integern. Figure out whether it is a truncatable prime.InputThe only line of input contains an integern(2 ≤n≤ 107).OutputOutput "YES" ifnis a truncatable prime. Output "NO" otherwise. Quotes for clarity only.ExamplesInput19OutputNOInput9137OutputYESNoteIn the first sample 19 is a prime but its suffix 9 is not.In the second sample 9137, 137, 37 and 7 are all primes, so 9137 is a truncatable prime.

processed.result:
Determine if a given positive integer $n$ (where $2 \le n \le 10^7$) is a truncatable prime. 

A truncatable prime is a prime number that meets these conditions:

* It does not contain the digit 0.
* All of its suffixes (formed by removing digits from the right) are also prime numbers.

For example:

* 9137 is a truncatable prime because 9137, 137, 37, and 7 are all prime.
* 19 is not a truncatable prime because 9 is not prime. 



Let me know if you'd like help with the code to solve this problem!
Determine if a given positive integer is a truncatable prime. A truncatable prime is a prime number where all its parts (from the beginning to the end) are also prime.
